title: Research-Based Mathematics Learning Achievement Improvement Program

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: Blended learning environment combining smartphone-based digital resources with offline activities. Limited in-class interaction, with a need to secure individual learning time

learning_goals: Learners can explain middle school mathematics concepts (equations, functions, geometry) with over 80% accuracy by applying research-based instructional methods.
Through hybrid activities conducted twice weekly, learners can effectively apply mathematical problem-solving strategies in over 70% of cases.
By the end of the course, learners achieve a 15% or greater improvement in math academic performance compared to baseline assessments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
